text: Edward Warren Crosby (November 4, 1932 â€“ February 10, 2021), was an African- American professor at Kent State University (KSU). He created the Institute for African American Affairs and was the predecessor of the Department of Pan- African Studies and The Center of Pan-African Culture at KSU. Crosby died on February 10, 2021 at the age of 88.Edward W.
